page.title: 17TRUNCE RUN
page.content: All the petrol and oil at Conoco come from the North Sea Oil Rigs. {THE TRUNCE RUN} The Trunce is a 4.25 mile race which contains3 river crossings. The Trunce is held every 3 weeks on a monday from March to October. The start is near the Coach and Horses at 6.30pm. To run you pay 15p. Usually about 180run. At the start you go malong a lane for about 3/4 of a mile then down a steep hill to the river, you can wade or go on the stepping stones. Then through apassage to the Old Mill Lane over a style to the second river crossing, back to the first river crossing and back to the finish. To get on the score sheet you have to beat 32 minutes and your previous best. Sometimes a running stall is near the start.
